title: Latest and Breaking Coverage
text:
World

Qatar’s prime minister on Saturday said the Gaza ceasefire has reached a “critical moment” as its first phase winds down, with the remains of one Israeli hostage still to be handed over by militants. Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani told a conference in the Qatari capital that international mediators, led by the U.S., are working “to force the way forward” to the second phase to cement the deal. “What we have just done is a pause,” he told the Doha Forum.

title: Last call! The 30 best Advent calendars of 2025 that you can still shop before December 1
text:
Last call! Countdowns are flying off the shelves, so snag your 2025 Advent calendar before it's too late. Trust me, I'm speaking from experience here. (Photo Illustration: Amanda Garrity/Yahoo News; Voluspa)

I'm not here to get your tinsel in a tangle, but seasoned merrymakers know it’s already too late to nab some of this year’s hottest Advent calendars. So consider this your last call! The good news: There are still some great options left — and many last-minute Advent calendars are on sale for Black Friday. In other words, there’s no time like the present to make your pick. I got my hands on this year’s newest releases and opened every single door — hundreds, in fact! — to bring you the best Advent calendars of 2025.



There are plenty of familiar favorites from the likes of Lego and Godiva, but the 2025 holiday season also brings some new Advent calendars for men and women, from a Hallmark Channel-inspired wine countdown to limited-edition beauty Advent calendars that offer impressive value (I'm talking $800-plus worth of makeup and skincare for $150). Not sure how you want to bring the cheer? You can't go wrong with countdowns filled with cheery chocolates, coffee pods, festive candles or mini bottles of wine. Or better yet, spring for a reusable calendar and stick whatever you want inside.



Some of this year's most popular Advent calendars — ahem, Bonne Maman and Anthropologie — are already sold out, and I'm sure everything else on this list will soon follow suit. My two cents: Make your pick now and yule rest easy from now until December 1.

Best Advent calendars for 2025

Amazon Lego 'Harry Potter' Advent Calendar Have yourself a Harry little Christmas with this magic-filled countdown. I solemnly swear that the 2025 version is even better than the last — it's full of collectibles and deeper cuts like Aragog and Thestral, along with the main characters sporting their finest Fair Isle sweaters. $40 at Amazon

Amazon Moyel Christmas Socks 12-Day Advent Calendar Funky socks make the holiday festivities all the more fun. Give your fashionista a dozen new pairs for just over $25 — all of them bring the cheer, but some are a little more on the nose than others (ahem, like ones featuring Santa front and center). And if you really want to up the ante, opt for the 24-day countdown to deliver double the fun. $27 at Amazon

Apotheke Apotheke 25-Piece Advent Set Apotheke’s 25-piece Advent set is a luxe countdown for anyone who lives for good scents. Behind each door is a mini candle or home fragrance treat in the brand’s signature, spa-like aromas — think Charcoal, Sea Salt Grapefruit and White Vetiver. $250 at Apotheke

The Woobles The Woobles Toy to the World Advent Calendar More people are turning to so-called "grandma hobbies" to relieve stress, myself included. And if learning how to crochet is on your to-do list, then follow my lead and turn to The Woobles for a helping hand. Beginners can lean into the fun with this DIY toy workshop, which comes with four full-size kits and a bunch of festive accessories, crochet hooks and other cheery add-ons. $140 at The Woobles

Kendra Scott Kendra Scott 12 Days of Joy Bestsellers I'm not going to pretend that spending close to $400 on an Advent calendar is no big shake, but trust me, this cult-favorite countdown is well worth the splurge. You'll get a dozen bejeweled beauties in gold or silver, totaling over $800 in value — from the bestselling Elisa pendant to the ultra-sparkly Mikki Pave Huggie Earrings. That means, you're basically getting the whole lot for half off! $398 at Kendra Scott

Sephora Voluspa Candle Advent Calendar Get twelve days of holiday scents in festive glass votives — some are sweet and spicy, others bring the outside in. The candles have an estimated 25-hour burn time, so you probably won't burn through 'em all by Christmas (especially if you have one of these nifty candle warmer lamps!). The cleaner the candle, the cleaner the burn. So, this countdown also comes with a gold-plated wick trimmer to help you keep things nice and neat. $140 at Voluspa

Pottery Barn Kids Pottery Barn Kids Classic Santa Felt Christmas Advent Calendar Pottery Barn always delivers on the reusable Advent calendar front with mantel-worthy trains, felt wall hangings and tabletop countdowns. This felt favorite is a Christmas classic: Stuff sweets, coins and tiny trinkets into the drawers, then put it away and pull it out again next year. Personalize it with your kid's name or family's last name (up to 15 characters) for an extra $16. $60 at Pottery Barn Kids

Best beauty Advent calendars

Amazon Burt's Bees 12 Days of Joy Advent Calendar The weather outside is frightful, but your lips shouldn't be. Kidding ... kind of. Pick up this Advent calendar (for under $30, I might add) and get a dozen full-size lip balms in seasonal flavors like sugar cookie and cranberry spritz to soothe dry, cracked lips all season long. $30 at Amazon

Sephora Sephora Collection Advent Calendar Sephora Collection is one of the store's best-kept secrets, and this 24-day countdown will introduce you to the brand's biggest sellers. There aren't any brushes in this bunch, but there are plenty of sheet masks, makeup bestsellers and limited-edition accessories to go 'round. Consider it a steal for younger beauty lovers dipping their toes — er, brushes — into makeup or anyone who wants to spruce up their stash with some fresh finds. $55 at Sephora

L'Occitane L'Occitane Advent Calendar You know (and love) the brand's almond-scented shower oil, but have you tried everything else they have to offer? You're just in luck because this Advent calendar is jam-packed with the brand's best skin-soothers, from nourishing hand, foot and face creams to luxe shower upgrades. A surprising standout: The Cocon de Sérénité pillow mist, which is bound to bring the calm in the weeks leading up to Christmas. $168 at L'Occitane

Lush Lush 12 Days of Christmas Advent Calendar Leave it to Lush to bring the calm amid the (delightful) chaos of the season. Unwrap a dozen bath, body or shower products in the lead-up to Santa's arrival — some are tailored to the holiday (like the Christmas Eve bubble bar), others will be recognizable to longtime Lush shoppers. $134 at Lush

Beekman 1802 Beekman 1802 The G.O.A.T. 2025 Advent Calendar I'm not going to pretend that spending $200 on an Advent calendar is no small thing, but here's the deal: This bad boy is actually worth it — well, actually it's worth over $460. That's right, you'll get 24 of the brand's cult-favorite face and body products, from nourishing goat milk soap bars to skin-saving serums. Everything's "clinically tested, scientifically proven and made for sensitive skin" (Beekman's words, not mine). $199 at Beekman 1802

Ulta Benefit Cosmetics Glam Cube 24-Day Makeup Advent Calendar Here's another beauty bestseller that's not to be missed. This year, Benefit has turned its holiday countdown into a festive game of sorts. Spin, flip and reveal 24 of the brand's holy-grail items — some are full-size (hint, hint, Benetint), while others are fun-size and perfect for future travels. $149 at Ulta

Best food and chocolate Advent calendars

Amazon Godiva Chocolate Advent Calendar Godiva takes the cake, er, chocolate in the Advent calendar department. It's pricier than Lindt, Toblerone and Kinder, but the quality and selection is top-notch. You'll get the whole trifecta in this countdown: milk, dark and white chocolate. Some are straight chocolate, while others are filled with salted caramel, almond crunch and sweet ganache. $40 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $41 at Macy's

Amazon Walker's Shortbread Advent Calendar I know there won't be a shortage of festive cookies come December, but who says you can't sprinkle in some (ahem, 24) butter-based biscuits into the mix? Not me, that's for sure. Fuel up for your own baking adventures with these timeless favorites, ranging from simple shortbread rounds to salted caramel squares. $32 at Amazon

Compartes Compartes 'Wicked: For Good' Advent Calendar Sure, it's what's on the inside that counts, but this Advent calendar's packaging lays the foundation for a delicious flavor story. There's something wicked behind every door — get a Good Witch truffle one day and a Wicked Witch truffle the next. Let all Oz be agreed: These flavors are anything but ordinary, everything from Emerald City Elixir (matcha tea latte) to the aptly-named Yellow Brick Road (caramel honeycomb). $80 at Compartes

Fly by Jing Fly by Jing Advent Calendar Fly by Jing's Sichuan Chili Crisp is a staple in my pantry. Yours too? You're in luck, because this holiday season, you can indulge in a dozen of the brand's best bites, including sauces, noodles and never-before-seen releases. It'll be a welcome change from the chocolates and sugary-sweet treats that dominate each December. $98 at Fly by Jing

Williams Sonoma The Grinch Advent Calendar Your candy-loving heart will grow three sizes with this cheery countdown, packed with a festive mix of chocolates, caramels and gummies that bring out Whoville's best. $22 at Williams Sonoma

Best tea and coffee Advent calendars

Amazon Vahdam Tea Advent Calendar I think I can speak for all of us when I say it's always nice to have options. This pick from Pukka has 24 (!) different tea varieties — yep, not a single duplicate in this whole set. Some speak to the season's quintessential flavors (ginger chocolate and sweet cinnamon), while others will help you wind down before Santa comes to town (turmeric chamomile). $12 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $12 at Walmart

Keurig Keurig 24 Cups of Cheer Advent Calendar The holidays are brewing, and so is your Keurig machine. Each morning, pop a new pod into your machine and for a cup of cheer. Sip on a variety of festive flavors from top brands including Green Mountain, La Colombe and Caribou Coffee. This 24-door countdown also has a couple of Swiss Miss hot chocolate K-cups for the occasional after-hours treat. $20 at Keurig

Amazon Tea Forte Warming Joy Advent Calendar Leave it to Tea Forte to bring tidings of comfort and warming joy this December. Each day, you'll get a new pyramid-shaped tea bag in one of 24 flavors — everything from bold black teas and vibrant greens to calming herbal blends. There's a tea for every taste bud, so you're bound to find the perfect cuppa to carry you through the season. A tip: Tell Santa as soon as you sip something you like, so he can stick a whole box of your top pick underneath the tree. $49 at Amazon

Best children's Advent calendars

Spin Master Games Disney Puzzle Advent Calendar Pint-size puzzlers can unveil a new challenge each day in the lead-up to Christmas. On Christmas Eve, they can connect all 24 jigsaws to create a 24" x 18" masterpiece featuring Mickey, Stitch and other beloved Disney favorites. $24 at Amazon

Amazon Play-Doh Holiday Advent Calendar Let your little sculptor's imagination run wild this December. They'll unveil 24 fresh tubs of dough, plus 28 festive molds and three punch-out paper crafts to create their very own winter wonderland. The set also comes with four how-to cards in case they need some inspo. $15 at Walmart

Target Micromallows by Squishmallows Holiday Advent Calendar Count down to Christmas one Micromallow at a time. The whole squad is decked out in their holiday best — there's Manny the Snowman, Darla the Reindeer and 22 other merry minis. No question, this countdown is one of the most-anticipated ones of the year. A friendly piece of advice? Grab it now before it goes. $45 at Target

Walmart Squish-a-longs by Squishmallows Holiday Calendar Instead of plushies, this Squishmallows countdown is loaded with 24 (!) squeezable squishes in their smallest size yet. A lot of the seasonal squad is represented here — Carrigan the Pink Christmas Tree, Falala the Pink Fawn and more. $39 at Walmart

Amazon National Geographic Magic Advent Calendar Kids love magic — and this countdown will teach them 15 new tricks to take to the stage. On the other days, they'll learn how to float coins on water, write secret messages and conduct scientific fun. $16 at Amazon

Best whiskey and wine Advent calendars

Hallmark Channel Wines Hallmark Channel Wines Advent Calendar A bottle of wine and Hallmark's "Countdown to Christmas" go together like Lacey Chabert and, well, any small-town hunk (Hallmark fans know what I'm talking about). Pour yourself a glass of red, white, rosé or sparkling wine before tuning in for the ultimate wind-down. And yes, I know the holiday lineup typically starts airing in October, but try your best to wait until Dec. 1 to start sipping. $140 at Hallmark Channel Wines

Flaviar Flaviar Whiskey Advent Calendar Make your spirits bright, one glass of whiskey at a time. Take your taste buds on a trip around the world with this top-selling Advent calendar, featuring the finest pours from distilleries in Kentucky, Scotland, Japan and more. You'll also get two collectible Glencairn glasses because, ya know, you should always dress for the job you want. $270 at Flaviar

In Good Taste In Good Taste Wine Advent Calendar Dreaming of a white (wine) Christmas? What about a red winemas? Well, you'll get a bit of both (plus, some rosé!) in this 24-day wine countdown. Each mini bottle gives you a 6-ounce pour — sip on one solo while you make your list (and check it twice) or save 'em to share with loved ones at holiday parties. $150 at In Good Taste

Yahoo Holiday Deals Shop 2025 (Illustration: Gabriella Turrisi/Yahoo News)

title: The best Christmas gifts you can buy in 2025, according to an expert
text:
Win Christmas with these crowd-pleasers — from a top-selling card game to personalized gifts that pack a punch. (LEGO; Shanker Golf; Etsfmoa; Dolphin Hat Games)

Sure, we still have some time before Santa comes to town, but you know as well as I do that time is running out. So, if you don't want to risk missing out on the year's hottest gifts from Calpak, Kate Spade and more top brands, then consider this list of the best Christmas gifts as my present to you.

I've got all the bases covered down below, from hard-to-please tweens and teens to the grandparents who have it all. Eyeing something special for your mom or dad? Forget the Jelly of the Month Club nonsense and opt for a top-selling back massager or towel warmer instead. What about a Christmas gift for your, um, very particular sister? Tap into the trends and get her something from Starface or Kendra Scott.

Grouped by recipient for easier shopping, this curated Christmas gift guide will help you find the perfect present for everyone on your list — from gift ideas for men and presents for women of all ages to the kids that they're raising and all the loved ones in between. Picks start under $10, so you may find some solid stocking stuffers in the mix, too!

Trending Christmas gifts

Amazon Body Restore Shower Steamers, 6-Pack Who it's for: Someone who needs some self-care Why I picked it: Sometimes, the only time she has for a little self-care is in the shower, so help her make the most of it with these heavenly smelling shower steamers. Made with baking soda and essential oils, these scented melts turn the daily wash into a spa-like experience. Each scent targets something specific: Lavender and Chamomile bring relaxation, Citrus Grove is a mood-booster, Eucalyptus Mint is a refreshing wake-up and so on. The steamers come in a pack of six, and each one lasts for at least one shower. "A small luxury that makes a thoughtful gift," said this caring Amazon shopper. "This set is my go-to gift for new moms; it's a simple way to pamper them at home without needing a spa day. I've given these to friends and my sisters after they've had babies, and they've all loved having a little something just for them." $14 at Amazon

Amazon Our Place Always Pan 2.0 Who it's for: The at-home cook who needs a helping hand Why I picked it: Oprah called this 10-in-1 essential "the kitchen magician," and it's been dominating Google searches ever since. But really, it's the minimalist design and versatility that has made Our Place the top-searched brand of cookware in 2025 — yep, it made Google's Holiday 100 list. Senior Home Writer Lisa Schweitzer put the latest version of the brand's bestseller to the test and confirmed that it's a multitasker's dream. "I had no trouble releasing eggs and searing chicken. The steamer basket that doubles as a colander is a huge help," she raved. Nab it while it's under $100 for a limited time. $99 at Amazon

Amazon Body Restore Heated Eye Masks, 5 Pack Who it's for: Someone who needs 30 minutes of R&R Why I picked it: Hot compresses soothe dry, tired eyes. How exactly? Well, they boost oil production, relieving sensitivity and that all-too-familiar sting. Get these scented eye masks at a record-low price and bring comfort in minutes — they slowly (but surely) heat up when exposed to air and stay warm for up to 30 minutes. My advice: Stash them in your bag for on-the-go relief, but keep a few in your nightstand for when you need a little help winding down after a long day. $10 at Amazon

Amazon Etsfmoa Unisex Beanie with Light Who it's for: Adults who plan to keep on keepin' on during the depths of winter Why I picked it: This beanie really lit up the charts last holiday season. It was a No. 1 Amazon bestseller all winter long and one of the most popular picks in last year's gift guides. I have a feeling it won't be going anywhere anytime soon, so I'd snag it for the hard-to-shop-for person in your life who, ya know, needs to light their way when they walk the dog, take out the trash or tackle some chores after work. They'll get eight hours of light on a single charge; then they can power it up with a basic USB charger before their next after-hours adventure. $10 at Amazon

Amazon Crock-Pot Electric Lunch Box Who it's for: Teachers, truckers and more on-the-go eaters Why I picked it: Think of this No. 1 bestseller as a mini slow cooker (20 ounces, to be exact) that anyone can take with them to keep food warm all day long. Plug it in about 45 minutes before mealtime for a piping hot nosh. "As a teacher, this has got to be the most genius item that I have ever been gifted/gifted to others," one teacher raved. "This item warms up not just soup, but smaller meals, in 30 minutes or less. I had a coworker who even plugged it in for up to 3-4 hours, and she stated that it did not burn her food. I would recommend to anyone who does not have a lot of time for lunch." $40 at Amazon

Amazon Marycele Candle Warmer Lamp Who it's for: Homebodies looking to bring the cozy Why I picked it: Lighting candles isn't for the faint of heart — there's the soot, smoke and, well, ever-present fear of forgetting to blow the flame out. Enter candle warmer lamps, which slowly melt the wax from the top down and release an aroma without a single flame. Crank it up to the highest brightness level for the strongest scent or dim the light for a subtle waft, then set a timer from two to eight hours to better control the glow. $23 at Amazon

Amazon Bedsure Heated Blanket Throw Blanket Who it's for: The person in your life who's always cold Why I picked it: We are headed toward the coldest time of the year! One of the best remedies for cold and gloomy nights is snuggling up with a warm blanket. While any old throw blanket will keep you warm, heated blankets are a must-have for those truly bone-chilling days or when you're too lazy to put on another layer of clothing. This pick — now at its lowest price in months — features a supersoft fleece material that is great without the heating, but even cozier with it. $46 at Amazon

Best Christmas gifts for men

Amazon LifeStraw Personal Water Filter Who it's for: The ones who are always on the go Why I picked it: Even the most daring types need to keep their health and safety top of mind when they're on the trails. Whether for hiking, camping or everyday adventures, this portable filter can be used to procure instant hydration from any body of water — minus the microplastics, dirt, bacteria and parasites, that is. It's lightweight, doesn't take up much space and will definitely be put to good use. "I love to give them as gifts," one shopper declared. "Not only am I secretly giving my loved ones a survival tool, but they all think it’s totally cool when they get it!" $16 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $20 at Ace Hardware

Amazon Shanker Golf Frustrated Golfer Socks Who it's for: Golfers with a good sense of humor Why I picked it: These silly socks are for the guy who's on par for greatness, but his golf skills aren't PGA-worthy just yet. Alright, I'm not saying they paint an all-too-familiar picture of your golfer on the green, but I'm also not saying that they don't. Stuff 'em in his stocking for an easy laugh or include them in a bundle with a bunch of actually useful golf gifts for something a bit more well-rounded. $10 at Amazon

Amazon Rak Magnetic Wristband Who it's for: Do-it-yourselfers who are big on efficiency Why I picked it: Here's an affordable way for your handy helper to get a whole lot, well, handier. The next time they're doing a project around the house, they can slip on this wristband to keep nails, screws and drill bits within arm's reach. Thousands of Amazon shoppers say it's a must in any toolbox, including one reviewer who bought it for her husband and raved that it "saves him trips back and forth and he doesn't have to worry about screws or nails falling to the ground." $17 at Amazon

Wonderbly Wonderbly Your Life In Headlines Book Who it's for: Hard-to-shop-for history buffs Why I picked it: You can customize just about any gift, but only a few personalized presents are actually worthwhile. This is one of those nice-to-haves that he'll happily flip through and leave out on his coffee for all to see (which, let's face it, is a major win). All you have to do is submit his name and birthday (down to the year), then they'll fill the pages with all the major newspaper headlines from over the decades. He's sure to recognize a few (like if he happened to be born on the day of the moon landing), but others will be a welcome surprise. $90 at Wonderbly

Amazon MoCuishle Shiatsu Back Shoulder and Neck Massager Who it's for: Do-it-all dads in need of some self-care Why I picked it: While, yes, you could always attempt (key word: attempt) to give him a shoulder rub, this electric massager will be more effective in working out his knots and kinks. Drape it over the shoulders or position it somewhere along the waist, then switch between three different speeds. "This deep-tissue massage hurts and heals in equal measure," one relaxed reviewer wrote. $20 at Amazon

Best Christmas gifts for women

Kate Spade Outlet Kate Spade Lucy Medium L-Zip Wristlet Who it's for: Your stylish sister Why I picked it: Your search for the ultimate holiday gift ends here. This gorgeous clutch is a chic phone, credit card and small essential carryall for those days when toting a purse is impractical. And while I adore the plum-like "Red Jam" hue for fall and winter, it also comes in light pink and a slew of pretty colors. The 79% discount saves you over $100 off the comparable value. $29 at Kate Spade Outlet

Amazon Laneige Midnight Minis Who it's for: Tweens, teens or anyone else who likes keeping up with the trends Why I picked it: So many people — from Amazon shoppers (30,000-plus picked up this set in the last month!) to celebs like Drew Barrymore and Sydney Sweeney — can't get enough of the look, feel and hydrating benefits of the leave-on lip mask. Jump on the bandwagon and pick up this festive assortment, which comes with three mini tubs and two nourishing balms in seasonal scents. $17 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $17 at Kohl's

Amazon Carote Enameled Cast Iron Dutch Oven, 5 Quart Who it's for: The cook who prioritizes function and fashion Why I picked it: A Le Creuset Christmas may not be in the cards this year, but this stunner is made of sturdy cast iron just like its, er, more expensive counterparts. From boiling and braising to roasting and baking, this kitchen workhorse does it all — and looks incredibly good while doing it. It can be used on just about any type of stovetop, and it's oven-safe up to 500°F. $60 at Amazon

Amazon Aveeno Skin Relief Repairing Hand Masks, 4-Pack Who it's for: The woman itching for some quality R&R Why I picked it: Because her skin care routine shouldn't start and stop at her face. Simply slip on the shea butter-infused gloves and rub in any visible product after the 10 minutes is up to reveal smoother, softer hands. "This is a godsend for my hands. I wish they had one body-sized," one soft-skinned shopper wrote. A tip: Snag each mask for under $4 a pop in this four-pack and divvy them up between stockings! $15 at Amazon

BAGSMART BAGSMART Travel Toiletry Bag Who it's for: Travelers who want to pack smarter, not harder Why I picked it: Frequent fliers love this lightweight, water-resistant toiletry bag, which has all the bells and whistles, including a front zipper pocket for easy access, side pouches with elastics to secure makeup brushes and compartments galore. And while it's on the larger side, it's sized to fit comfortably in a 24-inch suitcase (or, ya know, you can always carry it on its own). Even Oprah's a fan — this classic was also named one of Oprah's Favorite Things for 2025. $30 at Amazon

Calpak Calpak Luka Duffel Who it's for: Travelers who want to pack smarter, not harder Why I picked it: Frequent fliers (including my own mom!) love this lightweight, water-resistant weekender, which has all the bells and whistles, including a trolley sleeve, a separate shoe compartment and pockets galore. One swift shopper (and fellow mama) pointed out that she uses it beyond her travels. "I use my Luka duffel as a bag for my breast pump supplies when I go to work. It should seriously be marketed for this! All of the pockets are so great for storing different parts and snacks, and the shoe pocket is great for the pump itself. The material is awesome because it's so easy to clean." (Psst, this Calpak classic was recently named one of Yahoo's Most Valuable Products.) $110 at Calpak

Amazon Kendra Scott Mini Elisa Pendant Necklace Who it's for: The woman who wants to open a little yellow box on Christmas morning Why I picked it: Trust me, a little sparkle goes a long way — and this piece is proof. It's been a decade since its debut, but this Kendra Scott stunner gets hotter by the year, with Google searches increasing by 175% in 2024. There's a good chance she has one already (hey, the brand says it sells one necklace every minute!), but even if that's the case, you can choose from one of the other color combos — from this understated rose quartz beauty to more daring statements. $41 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $55 at Nordstrom

Crate & Barrel KitchenAid Artisan Porcelain 5-Quart Tilt-Head Stand Mixer with Walnut Bowl Who it's for: Bakers and cooks who say the kitchen is their happy place Why I picked it: I know, I know, this stand mixer costs a pretty penny, but it is hands-down one of the most useful Christmas gifts you can give. It's more than a statement piece; it's a culinary rite of passage that'll help even the most novice home chefs whip up homemade breads, pastas, sweet treats and just about anything else that needs a good mixin' for years to come. Last year, the brand dropped its first-ever stand mixer with a wooden bowl — and this porcelain number is all-new for the 2025 holiday season. $600 at Crate & Barrel

Best Christmas gifts for toddlers and kids

Amazon PicassoTiles Building Tiles 100 Piece Set Who it's for: Little builders who turn every room into a construction site. Why I picked it: "If I asked my toddler which toys are her favorite, Picasso Tiles come out on top and it's not even close," says Senior Deals Writer Chris McGraw. "We've built castles, racetracks, airplanes and UFOs (they may also get played with when my kiddo is nowhere to be found), and right now they're down to $40, though can you really put a price tag on a toddler's joy?" $40 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $46 at Best Buy

Amazon Scrib3d P1 3D Printing Pen Who it's for: Young creatives who want to bring their art to life Why I picked it: Kids can turn basic doodles into 3D creations. Crank up the speed to fill something in or dial it back when working on itty-bitty details. "Once we figured out how to operate it (starting, switching filament, pausing, stopping and cleaning), we were on roll," one happy parent wrote. "My son is into Super Mario so we are making all the characters from the game." While you're at it, pick up a pack of filament refills at Amazon so your crafter doesn't run out anytime soon. $35 at Amazon

Amazon Schylling NeeDoh Gumdrop Who it's for: Little ones who like keeping their hands busy Why I picked it: Kids can squish and stretch this glittery sensory toy to their heart's content, then watch it return back to its normal teardrop shape. "It's satisfying to hold and squish without being *too* squishy. There is a slight firmness to it that makes it really satisfying to squeeze and even to roll between your hands," one happy customer wrote. Just keep in mind that you can't pick a color when you place your order, so it'll be a pleasant surprise for both of you. $11 at Amazon

Amazon Skillmatics 'Lilo & Stitch' Poke-in Art Who it's for: School-age kids obsessed with Stitch Why I picked it: More than 20 years after the release of Disney's Lilo & Stitch, the fuzzy blue alien is still capturing hearts. This little guy has become even more popular in the last year due to the movie's live-action remake, and there are tons of new toys and games to show for it. This adorable tie-dye bear is dropping just in time for the holidays, so there's a good chance your kid won't even know about it. Pre-order it ASAP to guarantee on-time arrival, then rest easy knowing you're winning Christmas this year. $16 at Amazon

Best Christmas gifts for tweens and teens

Amazon Sol de Janeiro Bum Bum Jet Set Who it's for: Tweens, teens or anyone else who likes keeping up with the trends Why I picked it: Ask any teen and they'll tell you that Sol de Janeiro makes their favorite scents. Cheirosa 62 is the brand's biggest seller — it's sweet, nutty and as warm as the Brazilian sunshine that inspired it. Instead of wrapping up a single tub (it's a whopping $48), opt for this trio, which also includes travel-friendly versions of the perfume mist and body wash in the same scent. $34 at Amazon

Amazon Muid Benson Lying Flat Duck Night Light Who it's for: The too-cool-for-school teen who is still just a kid Why I picked it: When in doubt, go with a gift that'll really quack them up. Give this light-up duck a pat on the back to adjust between three brightness levels or set a 30-minute timer. I get it: They're too big for a nightlight (or so they claim), but who can resist a bedside companion as cute as this little guy? $19 at Amazon

Revolve Starface Big Lil' Gift Set Who it's for: The ones who accessorize with pimple patches Why I picked it: Giving acne products as gifts is usually a hard no for me, but pimple patches are now seen as a badge of honor for the younger generations. Inside this fuzzy, limited-edition case, they'll find a lip balm and 32 star-shaped patches that are just as cute as they are effective. The clear ones are best for surface-level pimples, but the blue stars tackle deeper clogged pores and, ya know, make a splashier statement. $20 at Revolve

Amazon Flip 7 Card Game Who it's for: Gamers who are looking for something new Why I picked it: Card games are cooler than ever right now. Ya know, the ones that they play with for minutes and then spend years collecting dust in a closet somewhere. This geometric wonder can transform into a star, triangle or one of 70-plus other shapes, so it'll take 'em quite some time to see all that it has to offer. "The fact that it is also magnetized is really neat as it allows some of the odd combinations to actually stick together and form free-standing structures," one proud puzzler penned. $22 at Amazon

title: The best White Elephant gift ideas for 2025 that everyone will want to steal
text:
These fun (and functional) gift ideas will bring the party. That's my goal, at least. (Photo Illustration: Amanda Garrity/Yahoo News; Getty)

Yeah, yeah — I know white elephant exchanges aren’t really supposed to be about the gifts. But as Yahoo’s resident gift expert, my eyes go straight to that present pile anyway. And let me tell you: I’ve walked away with more than a few duds over the years. Sure, the stealing and swapping is half the fun, but I also want to leave with something worth a little friendly chaos. These picks? They’re the rare gifts people will actually fight for — in the best way.



From funny gags to more useful buys, these white elephant gifts cover all the bases (for under $50, I might add!). Hoping to bring the laughs? Snacking chopsticks will do just that. What about a practical pick for people that you don't know as well? Stick with tried-and-true favorites, from a bestselling battery organizer that's a recent Yahoo Best Gift Ever Awards winner to a dimmable duck lamp (the top-seller from last year's white elephant gift guide!). These are just some of the highlights — I've also included a bunch of gift ideas for kids, tweens and teens, since they deserve to get in on the fun too.



Have more parties on the books this holiday season? Then head on over to our ultimate Christmas gift guide and our Secret Santa gift list to check everyone else off your list while you're in the shopping spirit.

Best white elephant gifts overall

Amazon HappyBag LED Lying Flat Duck Light I wouldn't be doing my job if I didn't give this little guy a mention. Last year, thousands of Yahoo readers picked up light-up duck and, well, I'm sure it got everyone at the party in the stealing spirit. Simply give the duck a gentle pat on the back to make it glow, then adjust the brightness level to one of three settings and set up the optional 30-minute timer. "I love that it’s USB-charged, so no fumbling with batteries and a full charge lasts all night — enough for midnight journeys to the bathroom (or snack raids)," one happy Amazon shopper quacked. $14 at Amazon

Sakura Box Japanese Snacks and Candy Dagashi Box Because food is the way to the heart, isn't it? Replenish their snack stash with 20 pieces of Japanese dagashi, everything from cookies and gummy candy to salty, savory bites. All bets are off on whether they'll share with the other party-goers, but for your sake, I hope they do! $25 at Amazon

Amazon Godonlif Candle Warmer Lamp Lighting candles isn't for the faint of heart. There's the soot, smoke, overwhelming fear that you forget to blow it out and the ever-present risk of fire. Candle warmer lamps are a smarter bet: They slowly melt the wax from the top down and release an aroma without a single flame. The brighter the light, the stronger the fragrance — switch between four brightness levels and set a timer to turn it off automatically. "I love that this lamp has an adjustable height to work with any size candle and that it helps my candles last longer than traditional burning," one fired-up Amazon shopper raved about this bestseller with almost 5,000 reviews and an average 4.6-star rating. $21 at Amazon

Funniest white elephant gifts

Uncommon Goods Unlock the Wine Escape Room Game No one would willingly give up a good bottle of wine, but wouldn't you like to see how badly they want it? Stick your go-to red, white or rosé in the cage, then they'll have to solve escape room-style puzzles and riddles to crack the code. "It is not easy to solve, but the challenge is worth it," one Uncommon Goods reviewer wrote. See? Where there's a wine, there's a way. $30 at Uncommon Goods

SeaRoomy SeaRoomy Burritos Tortilla Blanket If you’re aiming for the gift everyone will fight over, this burrito blanket is it. With over 6,000 five-star Amazon reviews, this ultra-soft throw wraps you up like a giant tortilla — equal parts cozy and hilarious. It’s big, warm, machine-washable and guaranteed to spark at least one “I’m a snack” photo op. $13 at Amazon

Amazon Charmin Forever Roll Starter Kit A gag gift that's still incredibly useful? Now, we're talkin'. This isn't your average TP; nope, this supersized roll has over 5,000 sheets and can last up to a month (not exactly forever like the name implies, but still). Spring for the starter set, so they'll get double the paper and a holder that's actually designed to handle rolls of this size. $35 at Amazon

Amazon Snactiv Pro Snack Chopsticks A little bit of flavor dust doesn't hurt, but it can certainly get in the way if you're trying to do literally anything else while you get your snack on. Enter my most random (but useful) Shark Tank discovery yet: finger chopsticks, which let you grip chips, cheese puffs or your munchies of choice without dirtying up your hands. Can you snack without it? Obviously. But should you settle for greasy controllers or a crumb-filled keyboard? Nope, and that's why it's a great white elephant gift in my eyes! $18 at Amazon

Most useful white elephant gifts

Amazon Nodpod Gentle Pressure Sleep Mask A good night's sleep is hands-down the best gift you can give, and this weighted eye mask may be just the thing they need to snooze soundly. It blocks out light while applying gentle pressure across the head, hence why the brand describes it as a "weighted blanket for your eyes." Thousands of well-rested Amazon reviewers gush that it's changed their sleep game, including a night-shift nurse who called it a "marvelous little invention" and said it "stays put even if you're a side sleeper." $27 at Ulta

orastone Orastone Rechargeable Hand Warmer This rechargeable hand warmer has racked up more than 6,000 Amazon reviews and a 4.6-star rating — and shoppers rave about how quickly it heats up, how toasty it gets and, yes, how cute it is. It reaches over 100 degrees in under two minutes, fits comfortably in your palm and comes in fun patterns with a handy wrist strap. $24 at Amazon

Amazon Ontel Battery Daddy Storage System This may not seem like the most exciting white elephant gift out there, but here's where I beg to differ: This beloved bestseller is one of those things that most people don't have, but would actually benefit from. Sure, the lucky recipient may have a system (or say they say) to find the battery they're looking for, but this organizer will divide them up by size and type to make the search a whole lot easier. It even has a built-in tester to ensure that they're only keeping the ones that still have some life left in 'em. $17 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $20 at Target$17 at Ace Hardware

Amazon Ototo Splatypus Jar Spatula Because nobody should let precious peanut butter go to waste. This jar scraper is basically a silicone spatula disguised as a platypus (naturally), but it has a longer handle and sturdier (yet flexible) base designed to easily scrape the sides of any jar or container. Use it to clear out the nooks and crannies in all kinds of things — jarred sauces, jams, yogurt containers, the possibilities are infinite. $10 at Amazon

Amazon Glocusent Bendable Neck Light Yes, late-night reading types can wrap this hands-free gadget around their neck to light up the pages, but that's really just scratching the surface here. Thousands of Amazon shoppers (including yours truly!) reach for it when they're crafting, tinkering or even tending to some household chores after the sun goes down. Tailor it to the task at hand — choose between six brightness levels and three colors until the light's just right. More than 10,000 Amazon shoppers picked it up last month, with one writing that they originally bought it "so I could crochet at night when my husband wanted the room dark for TV" but found it especially useful to "have on hand in case there's a storm when you lose electricity." $16 at Amazon

Best white elephant gifts for kids and teens

Amazon Rubik’s Phantom Cube There's more than meets the eye here. The black tiles will change color with the heat of touch, presenting the puzzler with quite the challenge: solving the cube before the whole thing fades back to black. Part gag gift, part brain-bender, this cube is a true challenge for serious cubers — but a fun one at that! $9 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $9 at Target$20 at Ace Hardware

Amazon Schylling NeeDoh Ramen Noodlies Let them squish, twist and toss these sensory strings, er, noodles to their heart's content. Throw them into a sensory bin to really get their juices flowing, or play with them as-is. Both are equally as fun. "This was a fun toy for my kids to fling around and pretend to be hair or whatever else their little hearts desire," one happy parent wrote on Amazon, adding that it's a plus that noodles are attached so they're "not all loose inside the package." $7 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $7 at Walmart

Amazon The Woobles Learn to Crochet Kit Grandma's hobbies are cooler than ever. Case in point: Google searches for these beginner-friendly crochet kits shot up 95% this year. Pierre the Penguin is the brand's hottest seller — this kit comes with everything you need to stitch the waddliest Wooble in the bunch, including step-by-step video tutorials, an ergonomic crochet hook, pre-started yarn and stuffing There's a good chance they'll get hooked (get it?), so tell the recipient they can always give Pierre a few friends (ahem, Walter the Bear and Felix the Fox). $30 at Amazon

Amazon Flip 7 Card Game Card games are always a white elephant winner, but I'd steer clear of the classics since there's a good chance the recipient already has them. My suggestion: Go with the deck that's currently dominating the Amazon charts. Meet Flip 7, a fast-paced game where you try to reach 200 points without getting any duplicate cards. Sure, there's plenty of strategy involved, but it's really a test of how much you're willing to push your luck. $8 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $8 at Target$10 at CVS Pharmacy

title: The 15 best Secret Santa gift ideas for 2025
text:
Maybe you picked the cousin you see once a year or the coworker you’ve never actually spoken to. No need to stress — these universally loved picks work for just about anyone. (Photo Illustration: Amanda Garrity/Yahoo; Getty)

You pulled their name — now what? Picking a Secret Santa gift sounds easy, but it gets tricky fast when you barely know the person you drew. Sure, you could hand over a one-size-fits-all Christmas present, like a gift card or some cash, but you can definitely do better. Start here instead: a curated list of Secret Santa gift ideas that work for just about anyone.



There's one condition, though: If they gave you a wishlist to work with, then I'd rather you buy them what they actually want. But if you've been left in the dark, then take it from a gifting pro — these Secret Santa gifts are solid contenders. There are good-smelling shower steamers that are a perennial Yahoo reader favorite, a lucky Lego set and and an Owala tumbler that'll keep their coffee hot for hours. That's just scratching the surface — I've also included lots of Christmas gifts for men and Christmas presents for women at great prices (all under $35!).

How to play Secret Santa

Participants write their names down on a piece of paper and place them in a hat. Or, if you're going digital, consider using a Secret Santa generator like Elfster. One by one, participants draw a name to find out who they'll be shopping for. All players buy a gift for the person they picked, trying their best to keep their identity a secret. During the gift exchange, participants guess who their Secret Santa is.

Best Secret Santa gifts overall

Amazon Body Restore Shower Steamers, 6 Pack People love shower steamers. I'm not kidding, we've sold thousands of 'em in Yahoo gift guides over the last few years. They're basically TLC in tab form — just drop one in the corner of the shower, then breathe in the good-for-the-soul aromas as it slowly melts. Each scent targets a specific need: Lavender and Chamomile bring relaxation, Citrus Grove is a mood booster, Eucalyptus Mint is a welcome wake-up, and so on. $14 at Amazon

Amazon Godonlif Candle Warmer Lamp Candle warmers are one of the most novel inventions in the last decade or so. Place any candle underneath this little lamp, then crank on the light, set a timer (anywhere from two to 10 hours) and breathe in the aroma as the wax slowly melts. No flames, soot or smoke whatsoever! "The candle smells just as good as when you light it and lasts even longer," one fired-up Amazon fan wrote. "I have used candles I thought were done and they smell brand-new under the light." $21 at Amazon

Uncommon Goods Greatest Chocolates of the World Exploratory Set Take their tastebuds on a trip around the world, one chocolate at a time. Eight countries are represented in this box — there's a pistachio-packed milk chocolate bar from Italy, chocolate-coconut corn puff snacks from South Korea and more sweet surprises from destinations across the globe. $25 at Uncommon Goods

Best Secret Santa gifts for women

Laneige Laneige Midnight Minis Lip Care Gift Set If you pulled someone you barely know, this Laneige set is your Secret Santa safety net. This adorable kit serves up five travel-friendly versions of the cult-favorite Lip Sleeping Mask — silky, ultra-hydrating and perfect for winter-chapped lips. The lineup includes both bestselling and limited edition holiday scents, from vanilla and sweet candy to chocolate and eggnog latte. $17 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $17 at Kohl's

Amazon Eachy Travel Makeup Bag Let me introduce you to a bag that'll actually hold all of her makeup and skin care must-haves when she travels. This No. 1 bestseller lays flat when unzipped, allowing her to see everything at a glance. It also features interior cinch pockets to keep products secure and built-in makeup brush storage. "It’s even better quality than I expected for the price," one five-star Amazon fan gushed. "The outside material wipes clean and dries right off without staining." Give the bag on its own or fill it with some affordable makeup buys if you're working with a bigger budget. $24 at Amazon

Kate Spade Outlet Kate Spade High Shine Studs Sparkly earrings dress up even the most basic outfit. These dazzlers from Kate Spade (available in silver or gold) are the perfect finishing touch — yep, even if it's a messy bun and leggings kind of day. $29 at Kate Spade Outlet

Homesick Homesick Luke's Diner Candle Ask any Gilmore Girls fan, and they'll tell you that Luke's Diner is basically a main character in the show. She can light this candle and make her house smell just like the Stars Hollow institution — I'm talking freshly brewed coffee, syrupy-sweet pancakes and plenty of small-town charm. It has a 60 to 80-hour burn time, which, ya know, will carry her through the first few seasons she's re-watching. $35 at Homesick

Best Secret Santa gifts for men

Amazon The Master Theorem: A Book of Puzzles, Intrigue and Wit He's got his Wordle strategy on lock, so why don't you see if he's up for a new challenge? These aren't your average crosswords; nope, this book is full of 40-plus escape room-style puzzles that'll have him cracking cryptic codes and tackling tough brain-benders. "They make you think," one escape-room enthusiast wrote on Amazon. "I had to come back to one the next day because I was racking my brain. Not so obscure, but hard enough to be a challenge." $30 at Amazon

Amazon Ontel Battery Daddy Storage System Ah, batteries — he's got a drawer full of 'em, so you might as well help him make sense of his stash. This storage case can hold 150 batteries in total, but the built-in battery tester will encourage him to only keep the ones that are in full working order. "Now I can actually prove the batteries are dead instead of just yelling 'try another one.' Organization, domination and a weird sense of adult joy — 10/10 would recommend," one charged-up Amazon customer chimed. (Psst, I'm also a huge fan, which is why I recently included it in our Best Gift Ever Awards.) $17 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $20 at Target$17 at Ace Hardware

Amazon Joseph Joseph Double Dish He takes snacking seriously — so much so that he’ll put this double-layered bowl to good use. Here’s how it works: Put olives, pistachios, wrapped candy or something else with a removable outer layer in the main bowl, then drop the scraps in the hidden compartment underneath. $11 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $17 at Target$17 at Macy's

Uncommon Goods Collect Your National Park Glassware He can't always retreat to the mountains, but he can pour himself a pint and think about the trails that shaped him. Choose from the 15 most-visited parks — go with a tumbler that represents his most recent adventure or opt for a park that's high on his bucket list so he can keep his eye on the prize. $20 at Uncommon Goods

Mark & Graham Personalized Golf Tees His skills aren't exactly PGA-worthy, but I'd say that style counts for something on the green. Speaking of style, go ahead and personalize a pack of 50 tees with his monogram on the top or a custom message (up to 16 characters) on the side. Dress for the job you want, right? $29 at Mark & Graham

title: The 30 best gifts for men in 2025 (even the guys who already have everything)
text:
He thinks he has it all, but I bet he doesn't have every single gift on this list. Feel free to prove me otherwise. (Amanda Garrity/Yahoo; Halfday, Nomad and Amazon)

Some men have a Christmas list the length of a football field. But your guy? He has the complete opposite, forcing you to turn to a stranger (hello!) for some gift-giving guidance. No need to fret because I've got you covered with this list of the best gifts for men — yep, even the ones who are impossible to shop for.



As Yahoo's Gifting Editor, it's literally my job to track down the right gift for the ones you love. But here's the deal: As someone who has a dad, brothers and a boyfriend to shop for, I know that it's quite the challenge to come up with something unique that they haven't bought themself (but, ya know, totally would if given the chance).



Challenge accepted: From useful gadgets that'll elevate his everyday to stylish finds from guy-approved brands like Cole Haan and Quince, you're bound to find the perfect present for the man you love — your husband, grandpa, father-in-law, you name it. There's a personalized golf towel that he can use on the course, a garment bag-turned-duffel for frequent travelers and a monthly subscription that'll take his tastebuds on a trip around the globe.

Best personalized gifts for men

Etsy Iron and Grain USA Personalized Leather Desk Mat He means business, but his desk says otherwise. Dress it up with a top-grain leather pad, available in three sizes, six leather colors and four rivet finishes. Engrave it with his name, initials or other text of your choosing. I think "the boss" has a nice ring to it. $37 at Etsy

Uncommon Goods Custom Urban Map Glass Let him raise a glass to his favorite city, whether it's his new home away from home or the place that shaped him. Pair one glass with his liquor of choice or give him a rocks trio that represents his past, present and future. $20 at Uncommon Goods

Wonderbly Wonderbly Your Life In Headlines Book His life is one for the books, so tap Wonderbly to help you put it in print. Submit his name and birthday (down to the year), then they'll fill the pages with The Washington Post headlines from the past. He's bound to recognize a few of the biggest stories (like if his birthday coincides with the first moon landing), but others are sure to be a surprise. $90 at Wonderbly

Etsy Custom Pet Golf Towel The only thing he loves more than a day on the green? His beloved pup. And while he can sometimes bring his best buddy to the course, this towel will ensure that he's always there in spirit when they can't be there IRL. Send a head-on photo of his fur baby to guarantee accuracy, then add your names and select the towel color that matches his golf bag. $36 at Etsy

Best tech gifts for men

Amazon Glocusent LED Neck Reading Light Your bedtime shouldn't get in the way of his nighttime reading. When the lights turn off, he can drape this bendable light around his neck to help him see what's on the page. It's not just for reading; crafters, tinkerers and handymen also love it. $20 at Amazon

Amazon Renpho Eyeris 1 Eye Massager Soothe his dry, overworked eyes with this heated massager, which has oscillating massagers to target 10 acupressure points. He can take things up a notch by playing a personal playlist or prerecorded sounds through the built-in speakers. $50 at Amazon

Amazon PowerUp 4.0 Paper Airplane Kit Some things never get old... like the joy of flying paper airplanes. Give a basic paper airplane a power boost with this smart, Bluetooth-enabled sensor, which allows it to fly for up to 10 minutes straight with a range of 230 feet. $60 at Amazon

Best style gifts for men

Amazon Shanker Frustrated Golfer Socks Here's a Best Gift Ever Awards winner that'll help your golfer step up his style game. And, ya know, give him and his buddies a good laugh. That's right, these silly socks paint an all-too-relatable picture of his days on the green. $10 at Amazon

Amazon Travelambo RFID Blocking Slim Wallet If the price of this 100% leather wallet doesn't win you over, the 56,000 (and counting) rave Amazon reviews will. "I purchased this for my husband two years ago and it is still in great shape. He uses it everyday and loves the ease of getting his cards out," said one satisfied spouse. Choose from a range of classic neutrals and hard-to-lose brights. $8 at Amazon

Quince Quince Mongolian Cashmere Full-Zip Hoodie Quince cuts out the middleman — clothes are shipped from the factory straight to your door, giving you even more bang for your buck. My boyfriend has tried their linen pants and basic t-shirts, but he practically lives in their cashmere sweaters (including this stylish zip-up) in the cooler months. It's quality stuff — it's incredibly soft, three times warmer than wool and totally timeless. $110 at Quince

Nomad Nomad Modern Apple Watch Band When the sporty look doesn't cut it, he can swap out his everyday watchband for this one made from rugged leather. Like most leather goods, the black, brown or tan band will look even better as it ages. $49 at Nomad

Best kitchen and grill gifts for men

Amazon Meater Pro Smart Meat Thermometer Grilling has gone high tech. He can connect this Bluetooth-enabled thermometer to his iPhone or Android to keep an eye on whatever he's cooking on the grates and get a ding when it's done. Senior Deals Writer Carrie McCabe had her meat-loving hubby put it to the test, and his glowing review says it all: "I've used this probe twice now, and I've honestly never grilled better meat — it almost feels like cheating." $91 at Amazon

Amazon Middletown Mixology SmokeTop Cocktail Smoker Kit The mixologist in the making will elevate his bourbon, whiskey or cocktail game with this cherrywood smoke top. Simply fill the chimney with a few wood chips, place the smoke top on a glass, light it up with a butane torch and take in the smoky aroma. $35 at Amazon

Amazon AeroPress Coffee Press He doesn't need a fancy espresso machine to brew his morning cup of joe. Nope, he just needs some freshly ground coffee and this portable press, which is a French press, pour-over coffee maker and espresso machine all in one. Just stir the medium-fine ground coffee and water for up to 30 seconds and press the perfect cup. $38 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $40 at Target$50 at Wayfair

Amazon Umaid Himalayan Salt Block Fire up the grill and sear meats, seafood and vegetables on this solid salt slab to infuse them with delicious flavor. "I was afraid things would be overly salty, but that is not the case. I pre-season things (without salt) and the block infuses a perfect salty flavor as the food cooks," one at-home chef commented, adding that it's "really easy to clean up after use." $55 at Amazon

Best travel gifts for men

Halfday Halfday the Garment Duffel This isn't your average garment bag. Nope, this one, which one Halfday shopper called "an engineering marvel," turns into a carry-on duffel with enough space to fit at least three days' worth of clothes, shoes and toiletries. Managing Editor Scott Simone has owned one for over two years, and his rave review helped it earn a spot on our list of the best luggage of 2025. $102 at Halfday

Amazon Gonex Compression Packing Cubes, Set of 6 These compression packing cubes made Google's Holiday 100 list back in 2023, but the best trends never go out of style. "I used all but the largest cube for a 16-day trip to Europe, which I packed for in a carry-on size roller suitcase. I used a capsule wardrobe, but was able to fit quite a lot into each cube," one efficient packer wrote. If you know a guy who needs to get his travel game together before his next trip, this trending gift may be just the thing. $30 at Amazon

Amazon Bellroy Travel Wallet He has more to keep track of when he's traveling abroad. This wallet keeps it all in one place, plus it's also big enough to hold his credit cards, cash, ID and other on-the-go essentials. There's even an extra compartment for a spare SIM and an ejector pin, along with a small pen to fill out customs forms or other documents. $145 at Amazon

Amazon LifeStraw Personal Water Filter Even the most daring types need to keep their health and safety top of mind when they're on the trails. When he's in a pinch, he can pop this portable filter into a body of water for instant hydration — minus the microplastics, dirt and waterborne bacteria and parasites. $16 at Amazon Explore More Buying Options $20 at Ace Hardware

Best gifts for active men

Amazon MoCuishle Shiatsu Back Shoulder and Neck Massager While, yes, you could always attempt (key word: attempt) to give him a shoulder rub, this electric massager will be more effective in working out his knots and kinks. Drape it over the shoulders or position it somewhere along the waist, then adjust between three different speeds. "This deep-tissue massage hurts and heals in equal measure," one relaxed reviewer raved. $20 at Amazon

Bespoke Post Wren Insulated Dry Bag Cooler He can rest easy knowing his towels, electronics and other valuables will stay nice and dry in this durable, watertight bag. There's even a built-in bottle opener, along with an insulated layer to keep food and drinks chilled. $50 at Bespoke Post

REI America the Beautiful Pass for 2025/2026 It's about time that he checks some destinations off his bucket list. With this pass, he'll get free entry for himself and everyone else in his car at all U.S. national parks for a whole year. If you're lucky, he'll let you tag along for the adventure! $80 at REI

Amazon Sucipi Pickleball Backpack His passion for pickleball isn't going anywhere, so it's about time he has a designated bag to tote around the game's essentials. He can stash his paddle in the main compartment, balls in the smaller one and other on-the-court items in the zippered pockets. "It is very lightweight even with my paddle, 8-10 balls, sunglasses, a couple of hats, [a] cooling towel and a big Yeti water bottle," a pleased pickleballer commented. "I’ve only used it as a backpack, but you can zip the straps together to make it a sling bag." $27 at Amazon

Best subscriptions and digital gifts for men

Foot Cardigan Foot Cardigan Sock Subscription Box Funky socks make meetings, weddings and other obligations all the more fun. Send him a fresh pair each month with this subscription, whether he prefers something wild and colorful or fun but calmer (Foot Cardigan's words, not ours). Or better yet, give him both types for $20 a month. $12.99/month at Foot Cardigan

Yahoo Yahoo Fantasy+ For the fantasy sports fan in your life, Yahoo Fantasy+ is the ultimate upgrade. Now 30% off — just $24.50/year through 12/1 — it unlocks personalized draft tools, lineup optimizers, trade insights and advanced projections across all Yahoo Fantasy sports, including football, baseball, hockey and basketball. Subscribers also score VIP perks worth over $250, making it a winning gift for any competitive player. (Just a heads up: you do need a Yahoo account to subscribe!) $25 at Yahoo

Universal Yums Universal Yums Yum Yum Box This one's for all the serious snackers out there. Each month, Universal Yums will send him a selection of snacks from a different country — make South Korea, Pakistan, Greece or the United Kingdom the first stop on his food-filled adventure. The Yum Yum Box is the middle-of-the-road option with anywhere from 10 to 12 snacks per month, but you can also sign him up for a smaller ($18/month) or larger ($40/month) box, depending on how much of a snacker he is. $28/month at Universal Yums

History by Mail History by Mail 6-Month Subscription Give your guy a closer look at America’s past with this monthly subscription, which sends a replication of an important document, letter or police report from the last century to his mailbox. Some will give insight into events he's read about, others will be all-new discoveries for even the biggest history buff. $48 at History by Mail

Tinggly Tinggly Bucket List Gift Experience Because memories are the best gift you can give. Let him choose from over 10,000 awe-inspiring experiences around the world, from a hot air balloon ride in Temecula to a ride-along experience on a real race track. And while he can always stick with something close to home, there's a good chance the thing that catches his eye may inspire a vacation. That wouldn't be so bad, would it? $259 at Tinggly

Update, Nov. 24, 2025: We checked all product prices and availability. We also added the Frustrated Golfer socks, a Best Gift Ever Awards winner.

The reviews quoted above reflect the most recent versions at the time of publication.

title: The 25 best gift cards to give anyone in your life
text:
Nope, gift cards aren't always lame or lazy. When done right, they can be an incredibly thoughtful and personalized gift. (Lyft, Sephora, Instacart and REI)

Nope, gift cards aren't always lame or lazy. When done right, they can be an incredibly thoughtful and personalized gift. (Lyft, Sephora, Instacart and REI) (Amanda Garrity/Yahoo; Sephora, Instacart, REI, Lyft)

The humble gift card is both universally beloved and instantly delivered (if you go the digital route). So it's a win-win if you wait until the eleventh hour to sort out a gift for the hard-to-shop-for person. And while they're a step up from cold, hard cash, gift cards often get a bad wrap for thoughtless and overdone. Not so fast — I've rounded up the best gift cards that are guaranteed to surprise and delight.

Regardless of what they're into — whether it be traveling, fashion, beauty or spoiling their furry friend — there's something you can snag for just about any loved one. Plus, they'll enjoy the shopping experience of getting to select their own gift. Sounds like a sweet deal to us.

Update, July 1, 2025: We checked that all of the gift cards on this list are priced correctly and still in stock.

Amazon Lyft gift card For that long-distance pal you'd always give a ride to the airport under different geographic circumstances, this Lyft gift card can function as your stand-in. $25 - $200 at Amazon

Instacart Instacart Grocery delivery might not be a very romantic or personalized gift idea, but it's universally useful. If your gift recipient doesn't currently use a grocery delivery service, swiping this card (virtually, of course) will feel so luxurious. $25 - $500 at Instacart Explore More Buying Options $25 - $200 at Amazon

Williams Sonoma Williams Sonoma Whether they just moved into a new home or have been talking about wanting to redecorate, a Williams Sonoma gift card can help with that. The store offers home decor, kitchen appliances, and furniture for every room in the house. Psst, it makes a great housewarming gift! $25 - $500 at Williams Sonoma

Spafinder Spafinder What better gift is there than a day at the spa? Let your gift recipient choose a massage, facial or any other kind of spa treatment in the area with a Spafinder gift card, which can also be used on-site to buy luxe products by brands like SpaRitual and Pure Fiji. $25 - $500 at Spafinder Explore More Buying Options $50 - $250 at Amazon

Red Bubble Red Bubble If you want to support independent artists in your gifting, a Red Bubble gift card is the way to go. The site sells all kinds of quirky stuff emblazoned with the designs of creative individuals. Think wall art, smartphone cases, aprons, throw pillows and even fun socks. The options are effortlessly unique and unbelievably affordable. If you prefer, you can pick a design first then see which products are available in that print. $5 - $250 at Red Bubble

Parachute Parachute This one-stop shop for luxury bedding and bath products — think buttery-soft sheets, pillows, duvets, towels and more — recently decided to get in on the bed-in-a-box mattress game too. In 2019, Parachute launched a 100-percent organic cotton coil mattress. The brand also sells chic home accessories like candles and dinnerware. $50 - $1,000 at Parachute

Athleta Athleta Whoever suggested that new workout wear is the key to hitting the gym might be onto something. When you know you look good, you feel good. And the best part? Alongside Athleta stores, you can also use this gift card at Old Navy, Gap or Banana Republic. $10 - $500 at Athleta Explore More Buying Options $50 - $250 at Amazon

REI REI Co-op For your outdoor enthusiast friend, a REI gift card can help cover the costs of pricey camping gear, outdoor apparel or sports equipment. You have the option of sending a physical gift card or instant digital e-gift card. $10 - $1,000 at REI

Target Airbnb The world is their oyster — and with this gift card, they'll get access to some of the most beautiful destinations around the globe. They can put it toward their stay or activities during an upcoming vacation or if you're really generous, then it might just cover everything. $50 - $500 at Target Explore More Buying Options $200 - $500 at Amazon

Grubhub Grubhub Ordering takeout is way too easy these days. Make it even easier for someone you love with a Grubhub gift card. The meal delivery service works with more than 300,000 restaurants in more than 4,000 cities. Search by restaurant or cuisine — or get even more granular searching by food item. Whatever you crave, you can find it on Grubhub. $10 - $1,000 at Grubhub Explore More Buying Options $15 - $500 at Amazon

Best Buy AMC Theatres Movies aren’t cheap these days. Gifting your loved one a night to the movies is a thoughtful gesture, especially if your loved one is a movie buff. Throw in some extra cash so they can buy some snacks and drinks too! $25 - $100 at Best Buy Explore More Buying Options $15 - $100 at Amazon

BaubleBar BaubleBar BaubleBar is a mecca for jewelry of all styles, from dainty stackable rings to statement-making hoop earrings. The site includes a range of price points too. They have fine jewelry for fans of solid gold or gold vermeil, but they also carry lower-end fashion jewelry for folks who like to switch it up on a whim. Baublebar also makes custom items. In addition to buying printed or digital gift cards, you can design your own physical gift card! $15 - $500 at BaubleBar

Brooklinen Brooklinen A top player in the luxury bedding industry, Brooklinen has a strong following. Everyone’s gaga over the brand’s luxe sheet, duvets and cozy loungewear. As the company has grown, it has introduced affordable modern furniture and wall art too. Plenty to choose from at whatever amount you want to give. $50 - $500 at Brooklinen

Ulta Ulta In the world of beauty, it’s hard to find a brand more esteemed than Ulta, and for good reason. Shoppers can get their glam on from head to toe thanks to the brand’s exhaustive inventory of products to pamper their skin, nails, and hair, plus makeup from their most-loved brads, from bareMinerals to Mac. A great gift for the glam girl. $10 - $500 at Ulta Explore More Buying Options $50 - $250 at Amazon

Starbucks Gift Card Starbucks You can keep it in your wallet or load it onto your app, but a Starbucks gift card will satisfy your caffeine craving no matter where you are. Fancy coffee can feel like an indulgence, but a sweet gift like this will make a venti soy latte with an espresso shot feel like a guilt-free treat any day of the week. Of course, you can pick up a scone or a cake pop while you’re at it too. $25 - $50 at Amazon

Sephora Sephora Got beauty on the brain? Sephora has tons of products to make you feel pretty, pampered and posh. Makeup, beauty tools, hair-care products and so much more from brands like Benefit, Drunk Elephant and Philosophy are practically oozing from the digital shelves, just waiting for a spot in your makeup bag or vanity. $10 - $250 at Sephora Explore More Buying Options $25 - $250 at Amazon

Everlane Everlane The resource for sustainable, well-made, sophisticated basics, Everlane makes it easy to love shopping with them. Not only are their items effortlessly chic — we’re talking sweaters, denim, dresses, bags and more that will make you feel high-end overnight — but the brand makes environmentalism a real priority. $25 - $500 at Everlane

Uncommon Goods Uncommon Goods There’s no end to the quirkiness you’ll discover at Uncommon Goods — after all, it’s right there in the name. A gift certificate (of course, they don’t even call it a card) can score you things as mildly whimsical as wall-mounted chess boards and beer-chilling coasters to items that are totally out there in the best possible ways — things like velociraptor garden sculptures and smartphone-controlled paper airplanes. Let your freak flag fly! $5 - $1,000 at Uncommon Goods

Outdoor Voices Outdoor Voices This activewear brand is all about outfitting people to move freely and comfortably so they can keep their endorphins pumping. Outdoor Voices makes cozy, high-quality, supportive yoga pants, sports bras, joggers, jackets and more. You can even shop by fabric, and there are many specialty materials to choose from, including fabrics that are moisture-wicking, lightweight, water-resistant and recycled. $25 - $300 at Outdoor Voices

Allbirds Allbirds Love comfy, walkable shoes? Honestly, who doesn’t? Allbirds has mastered the art of producing stylish, supportive footwear, and it has the fan base to prove it. Slip-on sneakers made of merino wool, boat shoes built to conform to your foot and water-resistant running shoes are just some of its prime offerings. Also available: insoles to make your comfy shoes even comfier. $15 - $500 at Allbirds Explore More Buying Options $30 - $100 at Amazon

Columbia Sportswear Columbia Sportswear The activewear giant carries everything needed for outdoor adventure — or simply to brave the cold: fleeces, down jackets, beanies, joggers, hiking boots and more. They even carry cute, outdoorsy accessories, like an insulated wine tumbler, camping cookware and all kinds of bags and backpacks. Great for outdoorsy folks. $25 - $500 at Columbia Sportswear Explore More Buying Options $50 - $250 at Amazon

Sorel Sorel The name Sorel is synonymous with rugged footwear that’s also high on style. The brand’s snow and rain boots have tough, weatherproof outers and chunky, treaded, all-terrain soles — and they all bear the signature polar bear logo. Your recipient can also shop warm and fuzzy slippers, sneakers and sandals. $25 - $500 at Sorel

L.L.Bean L.L.Bean This household name is appealing to anyone who loves cozy clothing, rustic home decor, outdoor adventure gear or an iconic nautical tote bag. Shoes? Slippers? L.L. Bean has those too — and there’s nothing quite like an authentic fleece from this beloved brand. The great outdoors is even greater with an L.L. Bean gift card. $25 - $150 at L.L.Bean Explore More Buying Options $50 - $250 at Amazon

Amazon Amazon When in doubt, Amazon (if that’s not an actual saying, it needs to become one, stat!). The internet’s biggest and most exhaustive megastore sells gift cards too, and it can be used to redeem anything from clothing and housewares to electronics and e-books. And because Amazon is known for its industry-best prices and quick, convenient delivery, there’s nothing not to love. $10 - $150 at Amazon

The reviews quoted above reflect the most recent versions at the time of publication.
